name: LIV Coffee Shop
notes: New Marais-side spot. Add your tasting notes.

name: Kura-ge (Marais)
address: 2 Rue du Roi de Sicile, 75004 Paris

name: Saint Pearl
notes: Hot matcha latte recommended. Ask for extra strong (free). No laptops.

name: Creamy Daily
notes: Very creamy matcha latte. Laptops + plugs OK.

name: Vague Coffee
notes: Iced matcha: super refreshing; smaller cup, lighter taste. ~2 laptop tables.

name: Torré Coffee Shop
notes: Pricey for matcha, but strong option in the area.

name: Sisters Coffee
notes: Local gem. Large iced matcha. Homemade cakes change daily. Wi-Fi, plugs, AC.

name: Un Ami
notes: Cozy sit-and-read spot. Coffee might outshine the matcha.

name: Certified Café
notes: Hit-or-miss matcha (great or watery). Plenty of seats, chilled vibe.

name: Cortado
notes: Solid matcha; nice with pan con tomate. Better for chilling than working.

name: Café Nuances (1er)
notes: Expensive but excellent hot matcha; tea quality shines. Rose matcha is a fun twist.

name: Café Nuances (6e)
notes: Same quality as Nuances 1er; not a sit-down spot.

name: 8lithèque 八梨空间
notes: Unique, artsy space; open later than most. Matcha is weaker; coconut option is original.

name: The Coffee (Mazarine)
notes: Reliable Japanese chain. Regular matcha is standard; iced mint matcha is the standout.

name: Noir (Saint-Florentin)
notes: Go for coffee; matcha best hot with oat. Not a work spot. Handy for Sciences Po runs.

name: Wani
notes: Chef-run, stylish, superb food. Excellent matcha but very expensive; peak bobo vibes.

name: AKA Coffee Shop
notes: Matcha is light/milky; coffee stronger here.

name: JŌHŌ Coffee
notes: Cute spot in the 4e. Good matcha and coffee; friendly service.

name: Boma
address: 48 Rue de la Montagne Sainte-Geneviève, 75005 Paris
